title: Print/poster, Hard Werken, 1987
medium: Offset lithograph on orange wove paper
signed: Signature imprinted in black ink on lower right edge sideways: design: edward fella
inscribed:
Imprinted in black ink diagonally from upper left corner in upper left quadrant: HARD WERKEN/in Rottedam Netherlands/is a controversial young studio in the Dutch/design scene.  Their work challenges audiences to reconsider the/ boundaries between art and design, beween graphic space and/ environment.  Projects include graphic design for cultural groups,/photography, and theatrical set design; diagonally from center across lower right quadrant: Cranbrook Academy of Art/ Museum Auditorium, Bloomfield Hills, Michigan/use the Cranbrook main entrance at the corner of 500 Lone Pine/Road and Academy Way.  Park in Museum visitor lot and enter/through main door of the Museum.; diagonally from lower left across lower left quadrant: AIGA/*Detroit/ An event of the American Institute of Graphic Arts/*Detroit Chapter; Diagonally from center across upper right quadrant: RIK VERMEULE  of/A presentation of/Tuesday, January 27, 1987 at 7pm  


*The "/" is included in the text.
description: Traditional illustration of a college age young man in a suit carrying a variety of carpentry tools. Text in a variety of sizes, styles, crosses at center and extends to four corners. (pun on windmills)  To the left and right of the main figure are smaller figures of a male painter and a woman in traditional Dutch costume.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print/poster, Hard Werken, 1987. Offset lithograph on orange wove paper. 
Gift of Edward Fella. 1995-42-35
